Key Match Events: Javier Sanoja recorded an RBI in his Major League debut on Saturday and followed up with two hits in his first start on Sunday.
Connor Norby tallied his first career multihomer game.
Griffin Conine added three hits as rookies powered the Marlins in Sunday afternoon’s 10-1 victory over the Phillies.
Sanoja crushed Phillies No. 15 prospect Seth Johnson’s hanging slider to the right-center gap for a leadoff double in the second inning.
Sanoja pulled Johnson’s two-strike changeup for an RBI single with a 105.3 mph exit velocity.
Nick Fortes doubled, and Sanoja scored from first with a sprint speed of 28.9 ft/sec.
Post-Match Reflections: Sanoja expressed surprise at his rapid progress and credited winter ball and Venezuelan baseball veterans for his improvement.
Manager Skip Schumaker praised Sanoja's discipline and ability to force pitchers to come inside the strike zone.
Sanoja shared his emotional reaction to his debut and the special moments with his teammates.
